purpose.summary: This file is the source specification for generating an IMS Program Specification Block (PSB) named PAUTBUNL for a COBOL language program. It defines a single database PCB named PAUTBPCB for accessing the IMS database DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 with processing option PROCOPT=GOTP (Get Unique Positioned) and key length 14. The PCB senses the root segment PAUTSUM0 (PARENT=0) and its child segment PAUTDTL1 (PARENT=PAUTSUM0), establishing the program's hierarchical access path to the database.

inputs.name: DBPAUTP0
inputs.description: IMS database accessed via PAUTBPCB PCB, with sensed segments PAUTSUM0 (root) and PAUTDTL1 (child of PAUTSUM0)

business_rules.description: Database PCB PAUTBPCB provides read access to DBPAUTP0 using PROCOPT=GOTP (Get Unique Positioned) with KEYLEN=14
business_rules.logic_summary: Specifies positioned GET UNIQUE calls for sequential or keyed database retrieval without update capabilities

business_rules.description: Senses specific segment hierarchy: PAUTSUM0 as root segment (PARENT=0) and PAUTDTL1 as dependent child segment (PARENT=PAUTSUM0)
business_rules.logic_summary: Limits program access to only these segments in the defined parent-child relationship for qualified or unqualified SSAs

open_questions.question: What is the exact business purpose of the DBPAUTP0 database and its segments PAUTSUM0/PAUTDTL1?
open_questions.context: PSB defines access but does not describe data content or business meaning
open_questions.suggestion: Review associated DBD source or COBOL program PAUTBUNL for data definitions

open_questions.question: Does the program PAUTBUNL perform file I/O in addition to IMS DB access?
open_questions.context: PSB only defines IMS DB PCB; no file or other I/O specified here
open_questions.suggestion: Examine the COBOL source code for PAUTBUNL
